review_blob: I had high expections facing the 4 pack in front of me but the nose and flavour was definitely too burnt and this Ale also finishes a little on the bitter side for me.
Looks very nice and pours nicely. It has a sweet malty flavour with a hint of chocolate and nuts. It promises more than it dellivers though as it lacks in body and  richness.
A better than average lager which has a nice golden appearance. It lacks in aroma and richness when compared to some of the european lagers, eminently drinkable but i didnt feel like up to a Tango.
Pours with a diminishing head which brings your expectations right down. In a funny way this helps the Ale as the aroma and flavour is surprisingly pleasant.

Rich and deep gold in colour, Laces nicely. Aroma drags you in across the room. The triple decoction makes the difference and the flavour is a superb balance of malty sweetness and crisp hoppiness. I would sell someones child for one right now. Not my child but... you know...

Tasted one recently to confirm that it hadnt changed in the last 10 years. It hasnt and still is a non-event. Like a tupperware party. A bit contrived and as a result the ladies commands all the attention.

The imported version of this is absolutely miles different from the product brewed on licence. The imported Stella would score about a 4 but the local version tastes watered down and lacks the hoppy aroma that distinguishes great pilsners like Urquell and others. When in NZ I avoid any beer brewed on licence...
Bottled. One of New Zealands best Pilsners. A great traditional, hoppy nose which tells the story of great Lagers without being too bitter. Wonderfully crisp. Highly recommended.

For Petes sake. What a waste of glass. What a waste of aluminium. What a waste of money. Put a loaf of burnt bread in a blender with a pound of sugar and a bit of sherry and you get the picture. Never again.

The best you can say about this beer is that is quite easy to drink. It has very little to offer someone who actually enjoys real Ale. I think it probably tased quite good about 100 years ago after spending a whole day bent over sheep.
A really great fruity Bitter. It has a distinct and refreshing berry flavour and is among NewZealands top 10 beers. Surprisingly absent from many of the outets selling other Emersons.

I am a huge fan of Pilsner as a style and as such I am a bit of a traditionalist. I can see why so many like the beer. Its distinctive with a huge fruity flavour. Passionfruit. So is it a pilsner...? I dont think so.

This is the beer that made me join the site. So good it moved me to want to tell people about it. Not normally a Bitter fan this one is quite exceptional. A full malty flavour, smooth and a great lingering finish. The bottle reuse scheme they have set up is all good too.
The beer has changed for the better since it was brewed on licence. Now brewed on its own premises it is a great drop. It is a skillfully made, full flavoured lager and I will drink many more...
